result.execSummary:
The defendant Ciara A Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders fine in the amount of $338.60 and a DNA Surcharge cost in the amount of $200.00. Court grants 9 days credit in the amount of $450.00. Remaining balance to be paid at $15.00 a month commencing 12/01/18 and each month thereafter or a penalty of 2 days jail for non-payment.

Restitution to be determined at a later date.
02/06/2019 PER RESTITUTION HEARING, RESTITUTION SET TO ZERO.
Cost to be paid with fine.
Court orders 4 days jail. Court grants 13 days credit. TIME SERVED

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Case 17CF846  dismissed and read into this case.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Menden advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

10:11 AM Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Ciara A Ray did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews the case on the record. Atty. Menden presents statements.  Atty. Woller presents statements.  Atty. Menden is requesting restitution be set at 0 and presents additional statements.  Court will grant Atty. Menden's request and order that restitution be set at $0.00.
Restitution hearing on February 6, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Restitution hearing on January 28, 2019 at 09:00 am.
Letter from Atty. Benedict requesting an adjournment.  **Request to adjourn is granted by the Court on 12/18/18.**
Restitution hearing on December 20, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ciara A Ray in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State presents their recommendations for sentencing.  Atty. Menden presents her recommendations for sentencing.  State confirms that there is possible restitution being sought in the total amount of $562.21.  Atty. Menden objects and requests the matter be set for a restitution hearing.  Court will adjourn for hearing on the objection to the restitution amount.  Court will order that if the parties are able to resolve the restitution prior to the next court date they advise the court in writing by 12/10/2018.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:

COUNT 1:

4 DAYS JAIL (CREDIT - 13 days) **TIME SERVED**

FINE: $338.60

RESTITUTION:  $562.21 (total being sought between all victims/businesses - to be addressed at the restitution hearing).

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

COURT WILL AWARD remaining 9 Days Credit towards fine/DNA/possible restitution which is $450.00 off the total amount owed.  Remaining amount to be paid within 6 months at a rate of $15.00/month.

* Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

Case recalled at 2:16 pm; appearances remain the same.  Atty. Menden was wondering if the defendant still needs to be on GPS monitoring as ordered as a condition of bail.  As the defendant was sentenced todaythe  GPS monitoring is no longer necessary.  Court orders the defendant to report to WCS after court today to have it removed.  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 20, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on:  9/27/18
Hearing on October 29, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with co-actor/victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to report to WCS within 24 hours after their release from custody.

Defendant Ciara A Ray in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews the case on the record.  Court will quash the warrant.  Atty. Menden presents statements to the court with regards to the defendant's missed court appearances.  State presents statements and is requesting cash bail be set.  Atty. Menden responds.  Court will set a signature bond in this matter but will order the defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through WCS.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for October 29, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
filed by Atty. Eryn Menden.
